title: ’Hawks set to defend the nest
text: Tweet Steve Lewis/Durango Herald file photo Fort Lewis College junior captain Yannis Becker has been all over the field for the Skyhawks this season, helping the team receive votes in the NCAA Division II men’s soccer poll. FLC will look to win its seventh game in a row at 3 p.m. Friday against Westminster College, a new team to the RMAC this season. Steve Lewis/Durango Herald file photo Fort Lewis College junior captain Yannis Becker has been all over the field for the Skyhawks this season, helping the team receive votes in the NCAA Division II men’s soccer poll. FLC will look to win its seventh game in a row at 3 p.m. Friday against Westminster College, a new team to the RMAC this season. Tweet Jerry McBride/Durango Herald file photo Fort Lewis College’s Haleigh Macomb has been stout on defense for the Skyhawks this season, helping the defense give up only seven goals through eight games this season. The women’s team will try to win a third in a row at 12:30 p.m. Friday against Western State. Jerry McBride/Durango Herald file photo Fort Lewis College’s Haleigh Macomb has been stout on defense for the Skyhawks this season, helping the defense give up only seven goals through eight games this season. The women’s team will try to win a third in a row at 12:30 p.m. Friday against Western State.
